posts.cooked:
Hi everyone,

My team is attempting to use our limelight this year and we’re new to this whole thing, however were confused as to how to wire it. Our PDP is currently full on spots, as our Pneumatics Hub, VRM , and Roborio take up all the spots and don’t leave any options to wire our limelight. Is there a different spot we would be able to wire it? Thanks.

posts.name: Kayla Toll
posts.cooked: Are you powering anything other than the radio with the VRM ? Which limelight do you have?

Our VRM is only powering the radio. We’re using the Limelight Two - We eventually figured out we could POE the Limelight directly to the radio. The docs was confusing us all because it didn’t really mention the new radio.

Storytime on that actually, about an hour after we POE’d our Limelight to the radio our VRM quit working. We dismantled it and found out a chip inside completely melted itself so we had to replace our VRM . It smelled really bad too like it had burnt itself from overheating or something similar. I don’t necessarily blame the Limelight because we’ve been using that VRM for over two years, but we all found it to be strange timing.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
StarManTheGamer:

about an hour after we POE’d our Limelight to the radio our VRM quit working

That sounds about right if you connected to the 0.5 A port on the VRM . The 2A port (1.5A continuous) should handle the radio and LL2 okay (assuming the LEDs aren’t on).
Our REV POE Injector is currently connected to the 12V/2A port on our VRM .

posts.name: Kayla Toll
posts.cooked:
I’m glad you figured it out! As a future inspector, though, I’m going to warn you that you will need an 18 AWG wire ( or bigger, though I’m not sure it would fit) between the other 12V 2A port on your VRM to the 12V input on your radio. This is from R626 from team update 8 I think. You can keep using the Poe injector too. Before the RPM came out, my team had two power lines from the VRM all the time.

My team also had a VRM melt once, we never figured it out either. We replaced it and we never had any more issues and we didn’t do anything different, so we never figured out what the problem was.

posts.name: philso
posts.cooked:
We have used these terminal blocks for our low current power feeds for several years now. There are versions with screw clamp terminals, like the old Roborio power terminal block.

https://www.amazon.com/dp/B091F9CGQF/?coliid=I26SC227V65NME&colid=3JCHHRLBCM862&psc=1&ref_=list_c_wl_lv_ov_lig_dp_it

link_counts.title: 16Amp AC/DC 2x12 Position Terminal Block Distribution Module: Amazon.com: Industrial & Scientific

posts.cooked:
Thanks for letting us know. My team took a look at the updates after you told us, and we made the change to put the 18 AWG wire in the other 12V 2A Port. We were at first kind of confused as to why we had to do this, but after reading the update it all added up. Didn’t have any issues doing it, and everything works just fine.

Our second VRM is holding up as well now, so i think we’re good for our Limelight and can begin working with April tags. I appreciate the assistance!
